## BEGIN: What They Do in the Shadows
DM [CreamPuff] BOT 02-03-2024 01:22
*You find yourself in the familiar comfort of the Blue Water Inn's warmth. There's a giant fire roaring in the fireplace. The aroma of grilled wolf steak, roasted beets, sweet potato pie, and mulled wine wafts through the air. There are not too many places in this dreary valley that offers respite, but this is one of the few. As you drink your libations of choice and chow down on a hot meal lovingly prepared by the Martikovs, the friendly and witty proprietors of the inn, the dining room is surprisingly lacking in the usual noise of people shouting at each other or talking excitedly over drinks. For this moment, the packed dining room's attention is not drawn to some otherworldly lute performance or a bellydance, but rather, everyone's rapt attention is fixated on an older half-elf with graying hair and eye glasses. His cane set down on the bar, he is standing on a chair, hands flying this way and that as they punctuate and illustrate a most dramatic telling of a tale you find hard to believe, but can't stop listening to...*
Rictavio the Bard [CreamPuff] BOT 02-03-2024 01:52
"And that was when two frost giants came out from behind the hills where the train of donkeys pulling my carnival wagon were trapped in the mud!!!" The bard says with anguish and terror in his voice. "As they picked up Pickle and Juicy, my favorite of the donkeys, and were about to feast on them... I rushed forward, skid across the mud on my knees, and pleaded with them, oh, you big giant oafs, eat me instead!! Spare Juicy and Pickle, please!!" "Of course, they wanted to bully me, so they put my mules down and started tossing me back and forth between them like a hacky sack!!" His voice becomes more hushed, luring in the attention of the audience. "Little did these brutes know that Rictavio, the resourceful circusmaster, ringleader of the fearless traveling carnival, would have a trick up his sleeve!!" "When one of the giants got tired of tossing me back and forth, he threw me high into the air and opened his mouth, ready to catch me in his mouth and swallow me in one gulp! The gall!! The terror!!" His exaggerated gestures, with hands formed into claws raised high overhead, and his voice crescendoing to a growl, makes some of the children in the dining room whimper and cry. "Fear not, for I was ready -- I took out a little token given to me by a tinkerer friend from a place called Khorvaire and activated the magic it held within. Instead of falling into the giant's mouth immediately as he expected, I started to float down slowly, light as a feather." He takes a sip of his ale and continues seamlessly. "With the dumb giant's mouth still wide open, expecting to swallow me, I had the perfect opportunity.... and I took it..." he baits, waiting for audience reactions.
